nightlight:

nightlight was in a half-sleep state, she covered herself with=
 her wings. It was cold, but she hoped that soon all will be in home. She w=
anted to her daughter and check her safely.


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com=
, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
>
> Tucson notices the positive cha=
nges in Rodimus and gives a smile of satisfaction.  Yet his expression chan=
ges, one of grave concern.
> 
> " Yes, we will need stronger defenses.  I d=
on't think our fight with Magmatron is over by any means.  We won the battl=
e this time by getting everyone to safety but, there is yet the possibility=
 of retaliation on the enemies part.  I guess you could call it guardian in=
tuition. The old dragon must have had the same attribute.  Only now, have e=
vents escalated and I sense that the reason for that, is because of the dra=
gon's passing.  He somewhat kept the land free of harm, and not smaller cre=
ature dared to challenge him.  But with age, he weakened, and even Magmatro=
n who's strength always outshone his own, realizes that without the guardia=
n, it's easy pickings.  Well, not anymore.  Now instead of one guardian the=
re are many, and as guardians we need to step up our protection. "
> 
> He =
looks ahead toward home.
> 
> " This planet needs a chance to evolve.  And =
if Nemesis Prime thinks he can destroy this world, I will not hesitate to s=
how him that no one lays harm on innocent life forms without paying a price=
 for their actions.  I've been entrusted by the old dragon, to pick up wher=
e he left off, being sure NOTHING LAYS HARM TO THE PLANET HE VOWS TO DEFEND=
. "
> 
> Tucson had also changed, he had realized why the dragon had chosen=
 him.  Perhaps it was to help guide Rodimus and the other Maximals but, his=
 primary purpose being the all around Guardian Prime of the environment and=
 the creatures that lived there.  Rodimus was ready now, he grew all the wi=
ser and he felt that he could lead them to safety and beyond.  
> 
> " And =
with that said, I know my purpose now.  Rodimus, the Maximals have their le=
ader and I am flying next to him.  But this planet needs a guardian and I h=
ave been chosen to take that position.  I will always help you when my help=
 is needed, and I will help reinforce the defenses.  But when we return I m=
ust take my rightful place, the cave that sits overlooking the Ark, that is=
 where I must reside.  That is where he stood guard and that is where I mus=
t stand.   And when you hear my voice crack the sky like thunder, you will =
be alerted to danger before it strikes you."
> 
> Even though far away, Tuc=
son could now see the peak of the cave where he would stand guard and follo=
w the footsteps of the Silver Dragon of the past.
> 
> " We have a ways to =
go but, there ahead, we are approaching home."
